SENT.plain: A seventeen-year-old girl in apparent good health was found dead in bed one morning
Two clinical features of note were multiple premature beats present in her electrocardiograms for several years, and a tall thin habitus without stigmata of Marfan's syndrome
At necropsy examination the heart was grossly normal
At its margin abutting the central fibrous body the atrioventricular (A-V) node exhibited numerous fronds and outcroppings, some forming loop connections from one part of A-V node to another
Groups of A-V nodal cells detached from the A-V node were also found connected to the crest of the interventricular septum
There were large connections directly from the His bundle to the crest of the interventricular septum (Mahaim fibers)
The A-V node artery was moderately narrowed but patent
The possible significance of these findings in the pathogenesis of re-entrant arrhythmias or ectopic automaticity is discussed
